page.title: 06FARMERS' ATTITUDES
page.content: "This is so peaceful: all species of birds are here and many varieties of butterfly. Of course, most of us here are not typical farmers having other financial interests". "The pressures of farming are increasing, they are like those facing any other business man. I have never been employed but it seems to me that these stresses are quite unlike those of a salaried professional man". "My concern is to prevent change. How do I influence Planners to avoid development threatened near the main road? The Hampshire Trust for Nature Conservation has just succeeded in purchasing one such area but developers are seeking other sites nearby". "Here, its just like England used to be: that is why we chose it. We're disgusted with the attitudes of the BBC over blood sports".
